header.div: Read the writing tasks and choose the type of composition which would be most appropriate for each one. In some cases, there is more than one correct answer.

ol.li:
In most countries the majority of crimes are committed by young men under the age of 30. Why is this so, and what can be done to reduce the problem?
advantages and disadvantages
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

Many judges prefer to sentence young offenders to do community service, such as working in an old people's home, collecting litter, or painting a local school, rather than send them to prison. This form of punishment has a number of benefits but also some drawbacks.
advantages and disadvantages
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

Prison serves no useful purpose for young first-time offenders. No young person committing a crime for the first time should receive a prison sentence.
for and against
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

Prison should be a last resort for young first-time offenders. It is preferable to sentence young people who have broken the law to do community service, such as working in an old people's home, collecting litter, or painting a local school.
for and against
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

As populations in developed countries age, those countries increasingly need workers from abroad. Developed countries should reduce restrictions on the immigration of workers and their families from poorer countries.
for and against
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

Every year thousands of workers from poor countries enter richer, more developed countries illegally to live and work, and this gives rise to a variety of social problems in those countries. What can be done to deal with this situation?
advantages and disadvantages
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

The birth rate in many developed countries is falling and, as a result, these countries increasingly need workers from poorer countries to help their economies grow. This movement of workers brings many benefits but also creates social problems for the countries involved.
advantages and disadvantages
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

We are all citizens of the world. People should be allowed to move freely, and to live and work in the country of their choice without restrictions.
for and against
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

Just as the state provides schools for the education of older children, it should provide facilities such as crèches and nurseries for babies and very young children so that working women can continue in their jobs when they become mothers.
for and against
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

In many workplaces women still do not enjoy the same opportunities as their male counterparts. Why is this so, and what can be done to make opportunities for women more equal?
advantages and disadvantages
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

Many of the problems in modern society arise because children do not receive enough attention from their mothers when they are very young. Mothers of young children should be obliged to stay at home and look after them rather than go out to work.
for and against
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

Some people argue that many of the problems in modern society arise from mothers going out to work and therefore spending less time with their children. Although the increasing number of working women causes some social problems, it also brings a number of benefits to society.
advantages and disadvantages
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

More and more people throughout the world are now living to a very old age and it is unreasonable to expect their families to look after them. The state should take responsibility for caring for old people when they are no longer capable of looking after themselves.
for and against
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

In many countries people are expected by law to work until they reach the age of 65, and then retire. Many people would prefer to retire younger, while some would like to continue working longer, for example until they are 70. Laws should be flexible in allowing people to choose when they want to retire.
for and against
giving an opinion (i.e. one side of the argument only)
problem and solutions

On reaching retirement age, many people feel that they are no longer useful members of society. Why do they feel like this, and what can be done to make them feel they still have a contribution to make to society?
advantages and disadvantages
for and against

Advances in medicine and health care mean that increasing numbers of people are living to a very old age. This creates a number of social problems, but at the same time has some positive effects on society.

section.p: 1. The key words here are 'Why is this so?' and 'What can be done?'

2. This task consists of statements of fact which you are not being asked to dispute. This composition is more descriptive than argumentative. The key words in this task are 'benefits' and 'drawbacks'.
3. The task is worded as an opinion to which you must respond. Notice the phrase, 'serves no useful purpose' and the word 'should'. These are clearly opinions, not facts.
